result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus A Hinton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same conditions as noted above for the fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus A Hinton

records.addlTxt: SDCNI letter returned: Not Deliverable as Addressed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:36 p.m. Defendant Marcus A Hinton in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by DE. Court orders: $100 fine plus costs w/ 60 DTP. Appeal rights given.

Pre-trial conference on May 25, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 8, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 2:23 pm: Defendant Marcus A Hinton in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Def wishes to waive counsel to speak with the State.    NGP entered by Court.  ADA argues for $1000 Signature Bond.  No statement offered by Def.   PTC and Pleas Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 11:45 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
